snippet: The city has been seen as a crucial battleground as pro-Assad forces and rebel fighters have each won, then lost, battles there....
abstract: Battle for Aleppo, Syria, is once again raging between rebel fighters and forces loyal to Pres Bashar al-Assad, reflecting intractable conflict in which combatants invest all they have but come no closer to defeating one another.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The city has been seen as a crucial battleground as pro-Assad forces and rebel fighters have each won, then lost, battles there.

headline.main: In Syria, Battles for Aleppo Seem as Endless as the War Itself
headline.print_headline: Battles to Control Aleppo Seem as Endless as Syria’s War Itself
